JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Associate Professor of Consumer Behaviour
Department of Food Science
Faculty of Science
University of Copenhagen

The Department of Food Science at the University of Copenhagen (UCPH FOOD) invites applications for a position as Associate Professor of Consumer Behaviour from 1 December 2022, or soon as possible thereafter.

There is a growing need for evidence-based research supporting consumer food behaviour changes moswltowards more sustainable and healthy choices in Denmark and abroad. With the current position, the Department wishes to expand the consumer research and teaching capacity by focusing on consumer choice and acceptance and contributing to a green transition. The position will support the long-term development of healthy, palatable and sustainable foods and facilitate a dietary transition towards more sustainable consumption patterns.

The Department has a well-established research area within consumer science with dedicated facilities for studying consumer behaviour (see https://futureconsumerlab.ku.dk/).

The Associate Professor will be part of the Section for Design and Consumer Behaviour (DCB), which is among the leading scientific environments within integrated approaches to future food design, innovation, and addressing consumers’ preference behaviour. The candidate is expected to work cross-disciplinary and integrate knowledge and approaches from fields such as sensory science, product innovation, consumer behaviour and psychology.

The candidate should have a collaborative mindset and is expected to develop her/his research in close collaboration with other research groups, both nationally and internationally. Furthermore, a close collaboration with the Danish food sector should be established.

The Department of Food Science is internationally recognised for excellence in food science research and education, strong industrial collaboration, and a vibrant international environment, where English is the primary working language. The Department has the mission to contribute with new fundamental knowledge and innovative solutions for society and industry to support sustainable food production, food security and safety, and production of palatable and high-quality novel foods promoting human health and well-being.

The candidate must have qualifications and experience within several of the following areas:

  • Consumer research methodology (incl. surveys) and data modelling
  • Models for consumers’ behavioural change
  • Barriers and drivers for consumer food choice and acceptance
  • Decision-making processes
  • Sensory food science
  • Experimental psychology
Applicants are required to have university-level teaching experience, documented teaching competencies, and must be able to explain and reflect upon their own teaching practice and portfolio. Formal pedagogical training or supervision equivalent to the University of Copenhagen teacher training programme for assistant professors is required.

Duties include the applicant’s own research, development of the field, assessment tasks, grant applications, and research management such as supervision and training of research fellows and other staff, and publication/scientific communication. The successful applicant must also teach, supervise, prepare and participate in examinations and fulfil other tasks requested by the Department.

Assessment of applicants will primarily consider their level of documented, original scientific production at an international level, including contributions to developments in their field, as well as their documented teaching qualifications. Managerial and out-reach qualifications of applicants, including the ability to attract external funding, will also be considered.

Six overall criteria apply for associate professor appointments at the University of Copenhagen. The six criteria (research, teaching, societal impact, organisational contribution, external funding and leadership) are considered a framework for an overall assessment of the candidates. Furthermore, each candidate will be assessed according to the specific requirements stated in the job advertisement. Please read more at https://jobportal.ku.dk/videnskabelige-stillinger/kriterier-for-videnskabelige-stillinger/dokumenter-til-meritering/5b_Criteria_for_recognising_merit_-Associate_professors.pdf .

Further information on the Department is linked at http://www.food.ku.dk/english/. Inquiries about the position can be made to Head of Department, Anna Haldrup, anna.haldrup@food.ku.dk and +45 93565698.

The University wishes our staff to reflect the diversity of society and thus welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background.

Terms of employment
The position is covered by the Memorandum on Job Structure for Academic Staff.

Terms of appointment and payment accord to the agreement between the Danish Ministry of Taxation and The Danish Confederation of Professional Associations on Academics in the State. Negotiation for salary supplement is possible.

The application, including all attachments, must be in English and submitted electronically by clicking APPLY NOW below.

Please include

  • Curriculum vitae including information about external funding
  • Diplomas (Master and PhD degree or equivalent)
  • Research plan – description of current and future research plans
  • Description and documentation of teaching experience and qualifications according to university guidelines
  • Complete publication list

The deadline for applications is 5 June 2022, 23:59 GMT+2.

After the expiry of the deadline for applications, the sauthorised recruitment manager selects applicants for assessment on the advice of the Interview Committee.

You can read about the recruitment process at http://employment.ku.dk/faculty/recruitment-process/.

Interviews/trial lectures will be held on 10 October 2022.

Please refer to the following no. in future communication in this case: 211-0407/22-2E.
